title: Man Solves Cockroach Infestation Problem By Accidentally Blowing Up His Entire Garden
text:
In a misguided attempt to exterminate all the cockroaches in his backyard, a frustrated Brazilian man decided to burn the cockroaches down. Or at least that was the plan.

Cesar Schmitz, 48, attempted to obliterate the cockroaches by pouring gasoline on his lawn and striking a match into a hole.

In a surveillance footage that's going viral, he can be seen pouring gasoline into a hole he dug and throwing matches into it.

What's shocking about the incident is that Cesar didn't think about his safety or that of his two beagles who are seen chilling on the neatly trimmed lawn.

After the several failed attempts, the explosion tears through the soil and the pooches scutter away out of fear.

Dude went to the Yosemite Sam school of how to deal with critters. pic.twitter.com/40ElxsFPem — Klara Sjöberg (@klara_sjo) October 20, 2019

“My wife complained that there were a lot of roaches invading our garden,” Cesar Schmitz told FocusOn News, according to the New York Post. “She is scared of them and begged me to destroy their nest under the ground once and for all.”

“I had no idea that this could happen,” Schmitz told the NY Post

“Luckily the damage was only contained on the lawn. If I had been standing closer or the table had hit me, it could have been fatal.”

According to reports, he is still clearing up the mess and will need to replant his lawn, but added the roach infestation has now been solved.

Local police say that they have launched an investigation into the incident after examining the footage but said they did not envisage any charges being made for endangering lives.

Cockroaches enter homes in search of food, water and shelter. Once they have infested an area, they can multiply quickly.

Cesar had multiple options to deal with the infestation from getting in touch with a pest management professional to using Boric acid to kill the insects, but he chose the most explosive way possible.
